text: All I can say about life is, Oh God, enjoy it!
author: Bob Newhart

text: The thoughts we choose to think are the tools we use to paint the canvas of our lives.
author: Louise Hay

text: This is the final test of a gentleman: his respect for those who can be of no possible value to him.
author: William Lyon Phelps

text: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
author: Margaret Cousins

text: Some do not understand that we must die, But those who do realize this settle their quarrels.
author: The Buddha

text: Character develops itself in the stream of life.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: Life is just a chance to grow a soul.
author: A. Powell Davies

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

text: The best thing about the future is that it only comes one day at a time.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Trust only movement. Life happens at the level of events, not of words. Trust movement.
author: Alfred Adler

text: Life is a succession of lessons, which must be lived to be understood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: You have to do your own growing no matter how tall your grandfather was.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: We cannot be more sensitive to pleasure without being more sensitive to pain.
author: Alan Watts

text: By living deeply in the present moment we can understand the past better and we can prepare for a better future.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

text: If A is success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Respect should be earned by actions, and not acquired by years.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

text: We need to find the courage to say NO to the things and people that are not serving us if we want to rediscover ourselves and live our lives with authenticity.
author: Barbara De Angelis

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
author: Alan Watts

text: There are two ways to slide easily through life: to believe everything or to doubt everything; both ways save us from thinking.
author: Alfred Korzybski

text: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone, best both for the body and the mind.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Unless one is able to live fully in the present, the future is a hoax.
author: Alan Watts

text: I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.
author: Alan Watts

text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
author: Carl Jung

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Feeling and longing are the motive forces behind all human endeavor and human creations.
author: Albert Einstein

text: There is no duty we so underrate as the duty of being happy. By being happy we sow anonymous benefits upon the world.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Six essential qualities that are the key to success: Sincerity, personal integrity, humility, courtesy, wisdom, charity.
author: William C. Menninger

text: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
author: Laozi

text: One of the advantages of being disorderly is that one is constantly making exciting discoveries.
author: A. A. Milne

text: Life is a succession of moments. To live each one is to succeed.
author: Corita Kent

text: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
author: Christopher Morley

text: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
author: Albert Camus

text: As you think, so shall you become.
author: Bruce Lee

text: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
author: Alan Watts

text: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
author: Richard Bach

text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: Bernard Shaw

text: For everything that lives is holy, life delights in life.
author: William Blake

text: Life is about timing.
author: Carl Lewis

text: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The person who lives life fully, glowing with life's energy, is the person who lives a successful life.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

text: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: I think that novels that leave out technology misrepresent life as badly as Victorians misrepresented life by leaving out sex.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

text: Life is a progress, and not a station.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
author: Euripides

text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

text: Life is divided into the horrible and the miserable.
author: Woody Allen

text: Life is a learning experience, only if you learn.
author: Yogi Berra

text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Life is what happens while you are making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
author: Baltasar Gracián

text: To enjoy life, we must touch much of it lightly.
author: Voltaire

text: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
author: Aristotle

text: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
author: Victor Hugo

text: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
author: Baltasar Gracián

text: To bring anything into your life, imagine that it's already there.
author: Richard Bach

text: All of our technology is completely unnecessary to a happy life.
author: Tom Hodgkinson

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Life is movement-we breathe, we eat, we walk, we move!
author: John Pierrakos

text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: To change one's life, start immediately, do it flamboyantly, no exceptions.
author: William James

text: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: To want to be what one can be is purpose in life.
author: Cynthia Ozick

text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: The exercise of an extraordinary gift is the supremist pleasure in life.
author: Mark Twain

text: There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
author: George Sand

text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
author: Hubert Humphrey

text: The universe is transformation; our life is what our thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: Love and compassion open our own inner life, reducing stress, distrust and loneliness.
author: Dalai Lama

text: To be tested is good. The challenged life may be the best therapist.
author: Gail Sheehy

text: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

text: I never did a day's work in my life.  It was all fun.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
author: Marie Curie

text: One who is too insistent on his own views, finds few to agree with him.
author: Laozi

text: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
author: Epicurus

text: Be content with your lot; one cannot be first in everything.
author: Aesop

text: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: Step with care and great tact and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
author: Phyllis Grissim-Theroux

text: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
author: Rumi

text: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
author: Og Mandino

text: The things that one most wants to do are the things that are probably most worth doing.
author: Winifred Holtby

text: You yourself must strive. The Buddhas only point the way.
author: The Buddha

text: People usually compare the computer to the head of the human being. I would say that hardware is the bone of the head, the skull. The semiconductor is the brain within the head. The software is the wisdom. And data is the knowledge.
author: Masayoshi Son

text: It is impossible to love and to be wise.
author: Francis Bacon

text: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
author: Rollo May

text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

text: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
author: Lewis Carroll

text: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Wisdom begins in wonder.
author: Socrates

text: It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

text: When in doubt, don't.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Imagination allows us to escape the predictable. It enables us to reply to the common wisdom that we cannot soar by saying, 'Just watch!'
author: Bill Bradley

text: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.
author: Ben Hogan

text: To lead people walk behind them.
author: Laozi

text: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

text: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world…
author: The Buddha

text: A single lamp may light hundreds of thousands of lamps without itself being diminished.
author: The Buddha

text: You always have two choices: your commitment versus your fear.
author: Sammy Davis Jr.

text: The smallest deed is better than the greatest intention.
author: John Burroughs

text: There are three classes of men; lovers of wisdom, lovers of honor, and lovers of gain.
author: Plato

text: Those who cling to perceptions and views wander the world offending people.
author: The Buddha

text: When you see a man of worth, think of how you may emulate him. When you see one who is unworthy, examine yourself.
author: Confucius

text: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.
author: Napoleon

text: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Laozi

text: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
author: Richard Bach

text: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
author: Michel de Montaigne

text: There is more wisdom in your body than in your deepest philosophy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: He who can curb his wrath as soon as it arises, as a timely antidote will check snake's venom that so quickly spreads, — such a monk gives up the here and the beyond, just as a serpent sheds its worn-out skin.
author: The Buddha

text: Sometimes I am happy and sometimes not. I am, after all, a human being, you know. And I am glad that we are sometimes happy and sometimes not. You get your wisdom working by having different emotions.
author: Yoko Ono

text: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
author: Barack Obama

text: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.
author: Lucille Ball

text: Ardently do today what must be done. Who knows? Tomorrow, death comes.
author: The Buddha

text: Let us revere, let us worship, but erect and open-eyed, the highest, not the lowest; the future, not the past!
author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

text: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

text: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
author: Walter Lippmann

text: With age comes wisdom and a high sex drive. And the wisdom to enjoy it.
author: Amber Valletta

text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
author: Aeschylus

text: Wisdom begins at the end.
author: Daniel Webster

text: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

text: Pure, holy simplicity confounds all the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of the flesh.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past; wisdom is of the future.
author: Vernon Cooper

text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
author: Augustine of Hippo

text: Wisdom is found only in truth.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
author: Baltasar Gracián

text: Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.
author: Sophocles

text: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
author: Norman Cousins

text: Much wisdom often goes with fewer words.
author: Sophocles

text: Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.
author: Phil Jackson

text: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
author: Sophocles

text: All wisdom does not reside in Delhi.
author: P. Chidambaram

text: Never accept ultimatums, conventional wisdom, or absolutes.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: Much wisdom often goes with fewest words.
author: Sophocles

text: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
author: Napoleon

text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure. We get very little wisdom from success, you know.
author: William Saroyan

text: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
author: Euripides

text: Imagination is the highest kite one can fly.
author: Lauren Bacall

text: All things change; nothing perishes.
author: Ovid

text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Everyone in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

text: A mind unruffled by the vagaries of fortune, from sorrow freed, from defilements cleansed, from fear liberated — this is the greatest blessing.
author: The Buddha

text: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

text: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
author: Bernard Shaw

text: Should someone do good, let them do it again and again. They should develop this habit, for the accumulation of goodness brings joy.
author: The Buddha

text: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Commitment is an act, not a word.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
author: Cicero

text: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

text: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
author: Laozi

text: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
author: Charlotte Brontë

text: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
author: Laozi

text: The day of fortune is like a harvest day, we must be busy when the corn is ripe.
author: Torquato Tasso

text: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
author: Laozi

text: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
author: Confucius

text: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
author: Molière

text: The power of intuitive understanding will protect you from harm until the end of your days.
author: Laozi

text: Whatever is not yours: let go of it. Your letting go of it will be for your long-term happiness & benefit.
author: The Buddha

text: To study and not think is a waste. To think and not study is dangerous.
author: Confucius

text: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
author: Anton Chekhov

text: I want you to be everything that's you, deep at the center of your being.
author: Confucius

text: From wonder into wonder existence opens.
author: Laozi

text: Better it is to live one day seeing the rise and fall of things than to live a hundred years without ever seeing the rise and fall of things.
author: The Buddha

text: If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts, happiness follows them like a never-departing shadow.
author: The Buddha

text: Science investigates; religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power; religion gives man wisdom which is control.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: I prefer the folly of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

text: To be wrong is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
author: Confucius

text: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
author: Plutarch

text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Irrigators channel waters; fletchers straighten arrows; carpenters bend wood; the wise master themselves.
author: The Buddha

text: No party has a monopoly on wisdom. No democracy works without compromise.
author: Barack Obama

text: Ceasing to do evil, Cultivating the good, Purifying the heart: This is the teaching of the Buddhas.
author: The Buddha

text: As you walk in God's divine wisdom, you will surely begin to see a greater measure of victory and good success in your life.
author: Joseph Prince

text: Whatever has the nature of arising has the nature of ceasing.
author: The Buddha

text: To give oneself earnestly to the duties due to men, and, while respecting spiritual beings, to keep aloof from them, may be called wisdom.
author: Confucius

text: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

text: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca the Younger

text: All phenomena are preceded by the mind, created by the mind, and have the mind as their master.
author: The Buddha
